intro: Dombeya ankarafantsikae, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
